channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Bill Ackman Turn Social-Media Stardom Into a Blockbuster IPO?
item.description: The billionaire investor is aiming to raise billions of dollars for a publicly traded fund next week.

item.title: The CrowdStrike chaos will happen again. Here’s why.
item.description: As tech companies get bigger, they create more “single points of failure” that can lead to cascading catastrophes across our connected world.

item.title: Carmakers' Inventory Pain Is Consumers' Gain
item.description: As Ford struggles with the cost of repairs, Chrysler owner Stellantis and Nissan focus on thinning out dealer lots.

item.title: Oil prices end higher on pause in risk-asset selloff
item.description: Oil futures settled higher Thursday, with U.S. and global benchmark prices rebounding from their lowest prices in more than six weeks and supported by a similar rise in other risk assets after a recent slump.

item.title: Medicaid Was a Boon to Insurers During the Pandemic. Now, Not So Much.
item.description: Insurers with a focus on Medicaid are seeing higher costs per member after millions of enrollees were forced out of the plans.

item.title: Gold falls to a three-week low, gets caught up in risk-asset selloff
item.description: Gold dropped more than 2% on Thursday after a better-than-expected reading on U.S. gross domestic product fed the potential for higher-for-longer U.S. interest rates, which contributed to a drop in the price of the precious metal to the lowest level in more than two weeks.

item.title: CrowdStrike Outage Puts its Financial Reporting Under Scrutiny, Too
item.description: The cybersecurity firm’s preferred revenue measure looks especially dubious following its global mishap.

item.title: Kamala Harris pitches student-loan forgiveness to teachers union: ‘A future where no teacher has to struggle with the burden’
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris highlighted the Biden administration’s efforts to cancel student debt and aimed to draw a stark contrast between the White House’s record and Republicans’ approach to the issue when she spoke to a major teachers union in Houston on Thursday.

item.title: An Increase in Uninsured Drivers Is Pushing Up Costs for Everyone Else
item.description: The number of drivers without car insurance has risen since the start of the pandemic, increasing the burden on everyone from other motorists to tow truck drivers.

item.title: Alphabet’s stock falls as OpenAI teases ChatGPT search prototype
item.description: OpenAI calls its offering “temporary” and for a select group of users before the company builds the “best” features into ChatGPT.
